intro: Anemone consiligo, commonly known as the white anemone, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes many showy, often toxic plants. The plant produces delicate, white or pale pink flowers with five petals, typically blooming in early spring. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and the plant thrives in moist, shady environments. Anemone consiligo is often found in woodlands and along stream banks, where it contributes to the understory flora.
